page.title: 20Industry in Norwell
page.content: There is little{industry}in the area and many people from Cromwell and Norwell{commute.}However in Norwell there is 1 almost cottage industry; at The Granary is{"Shapes",}set up in 1981 making plastic mobiles and brooches. 6 people are employed there. This survey was undertaken by the Headteacher, Mr D.Moulds and children of{Norwell C. of E. Primary School}who were helped by the following.......... Mrs Vera Sampson, Julia Buswell (W.I), David Hall (Farming), Roger Barker (Post Office), Mrs Broughton (Little Chef, Cromwell), Wallace Smith, Linda Gregory (Windmill), Mrs Pat Foulds (Watermill Farm), Rev. Bill James, Mr and Mrs Allwood (Plough Inn), Vina Cooke (Doll Museum), John Goodwin (Kids in Drama), Mr G.F. Hemingway (Cromwell) and Philip Mowbray (Photographs).
